arm_group.description: Ingenol Mebutate applied to one side of face with skin lesions
Cryotherapy applied to other side of face with skin lesions

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to find out the effectiveness of ingenol mebutate compared to
      cryotherapy (freezing of the tissue) for the treatment of face and scalp skin lesions.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ingenol Mebutate Compared to Cryotherapy for the Treatment of Skin Lesions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male and female subjects between 18 and 89 years old.

          -  Have at least a total of 10 non-hypertrophic actinic keratoses (AKs) on the face and
             scalp

          -  The subjects are in good health

          -  The subjects have the willingness and the ability to understand and provide informed
             consent for the use of their tissue and are able to communicate with the investigator

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects under 18 years of age and over the age of 89

          -  Subjects who are pregnant or lactating

          -  Subjects with sensitivity to cold

          -  Subjects with use of topical medications such as corticosteroids, alpha-hydroxyacids
             or retinoids 2 weeks before study entry

          -  Subjects who received previous treatment of target AKs

          -  Subjects whose target treatment area was within 5 cm of an incompletely healed wound
             or within 10 cm of a suspected basal-cell or squamous-cell carcinoma

          -  Subjects with use of medications or other treatments that could interfere with
             evaluation of the treatment area within 2 months before study entry (e.g., topical
             medications, artificial tanners, immunosuppressive medications, immunomodulating
             agents, cytotoxic drugs, ultraviolet B phototherapy, other therapies for actinic
             keratoses, or oral retinoids)

          -  Subjects who are unable to understand the protocol or to give informed consent

facility.name: Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine, Department of Dermatology

clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of Ingenol Mebutate and Cryotherapy for Treatment of Actinic Keratoses.

primary_outcome.description: The visual assessment evaluates seven clinical signs: erythema, edema, wheal vesiculation, ulceration, hemorrhage, purpura, and crusting.  Each sign is assigned a score of 0 to 3, where a score of 0 is associated with no expression of the clinical sign and a better outcome, and a score of 3 is associated with severe expression of the clinical sign and a worse outcome.
primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in visual assessment scores at 3 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor in Dermatology, Otolaryngology- Head and Neck Surgery and Surgery-Organ Transplantation

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
